item.title: Sarah add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Reader, I married him." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I can live alone, if self-respect, and circumstances require me so to do. I need not sell my soul to buy bliss. I have an inward treasure born with me, which can keep me alive if all extraneous delights should be withheld, or offered only at a price I cannot afford to give." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "th blu nyt th stRs u can't c th hum tht nevr gOs awy" -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Alfred de Musset
item.description: "How glorious it is – and also how painful – to be an exception. " -- Alfred de Musset

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Po Bronson
item.description: "But I'd rather help than watch. I'd rather have a heart than a mind. I'd rather expose too much than too little. I'd rather say hello to strangers than be afraid of them. I would rather know all this about myself than have more money than I need. I'd rather have something to love than a way to impress you." -- Po Bronson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Alexia Purdy
item.description: "The only battle that matters is the one within." -- Alexia Purdy

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "Better sleep with a sober cannibal than a drunken Christian." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "it feels as if half your life is a sort of struggle toward the sunlight. Then you get five minutes in the sun and after that you’re dragged down into the darkness again" -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "taking his lead from Beckett’s mighty Unnamable. I can’t go on. I’ll go on." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "I often watch “Charlie Wilson’s War” (2007) for the scenes with Philip Seymour Hoffman." -- Anonymous

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "their true characters were shown not in the war they fought but in the peace they made." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "It was a rare thing to be granted one’s heart’s desire." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Richard Ford
item.description: "to sit in the empty stands of a Florida ball park and hear the sounds of glove leather and chatter;" -- Richard Ford

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Richard Ford
item.description: "Stop searching. Face the earth where you can. Literally speaking, it’s all you have to go on." -- Richard Ford

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "The hoary judge put his mouth close to his ear, panted for a moment, made the announcement and slowly moved away, as though ungluing himself." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Measure me while I live—after it will be too late." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "how can I write about this when I am afraid of not having time to finish and of stirring up all these thoughts in vain?" -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "I am here through an error—not in this prison, specifically—but in this whole terrible, striped world;" -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "What are these hopes, and who is this savior?” “Imagination,” replied Cincinnatus." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "But even during this sleep—still, still—his real life showed through too much." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "twirling in his fingers the mummy of a cigar," -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Azar Nafisi
item.description: "Reality has become so intolerable, she said, so bleak, that all I can paint now are the colors of my dreams." -- Azar Nafisi

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Roger Ebert
item.description: "because an American can have a double-barreled last name but there is little practice for a triple-barreled one." -- Roger Ebert
